result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea M Whealon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor AMENDED FROM Bail Jumping-Felony, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance for the first year of probation.

charges.descr: Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor AMENDED FROM Bail Jumping-Felony

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance for the first year of probation.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
ATTY Tran requesting adjournment of status date 10-21-2014
Status conference on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrea M Whealon in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defendant has a case pending in Fond du Lac County.  Parties are waiting to see what happens with that case.
  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Andrea M Whealon in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Not allowed to leave Racine County. Exceptions are for any court appearances. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Andrea M Whealon in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Andrea M Whealon in custody.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
